projectDescription: Projects and assignments for Web 231. These projects showcase intermediate JavaScript concepts and DOM manipulation using functions and bindings.
Projects and assignments for Web 330. These projects showcase advanced JavaScript concepts including objects, classes, iterators, generators, and component creation.
Web 340 Capstone Project. This project is a NodeJS and express application that allows users to create appointments and new users using a mongoDB database.
This course presents the purpose of APIs (Application Programming Interfaces), their functions, and how to use and manage them in the context of web development.
This course presents the use and testing of APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) utilizing the Swagger and SoapUI tools. View the  Diagrams and APIs links above for more info.
An application with a list of composers and a reactive search and routing using Angular with TypeScript.
An application with sign-in functionality using Angular with TypeScript. Use '1009' as the Student ID.
This project uses Angular to connect a book API to a book list. Also you may make a wishlist and add books to it.
This project uses Angular to create a loan application form. It also uses a custom validator to check for valid form entries.
This project uses the MEAN Stack (MongoDB, Express, Angular, Node) to create a ToDo List with drag and drop functionality.
This project uses the MEAN Stack (MongoDB, Express, Angular, Node) to create a full-stack Repair Shop using the skills previously developed in languages, API, and framework.
This project uses the MERN Stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node) to create a full-stack Campsite Review site allowing users to register and create campsite reviews.
